title: Stocks close slightly lower as U.S.-China trade deal draws skepticism
text: U.S. stocks ended with small losses on Monday, snapping a three-day winning streak, after reports said that the so-called "Phase 1" trade deal announced by President Donald Trump with China was not finalized. The S&P 500 SPX, -0.14% was down 0.1% to end near 2,966. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.11% shed 29 points, or 0.1%, to finish around 26,787, based on preliminary numbers. Nasdaq Composite comp closed down 0.1% to end near 8,049. The outlook for a trade agreement came into focus following a Bloomberg News report that said Beijing would not sign off on an agreement until further details were worked out. Trading on Monday was quiet due to the U.S. Columbus Day holiday which sees the bond-market close even as stocks and commodity markets stay open. In company news, shares of Nike Inc. NKE, +1.07% finished up more than 1.% after analysts at Bank of America Merrill Lynch upgraded the sportswear business to neutral.
